docs.snippet: When Nepali transgender Bhakti Shah married almost a decade ago, his dream of being able to walk openly, hand in hand with his wife, through the narrow streets of Kathmandu seemed close to impossible to fulfill....
docs.lead_paragraph: When Nepali transgender Bhakti Shah married almost a decade ago, his dream of being able to walk openly, hand in hand with his wife, through the narrow streets of Kathmandu seemed close to impossible to fulfill.

headline.main: Nepal Sexual Minorities Back Panel's Call for Legal Same-Sex Marriage
headline.print_headline: Nepal Sexual Minorities Back Panel's Call for Legal Same-Sex Marriage

docs.snippet: The leader of a U.N. commission of inquiry that found North Korea committed crimes against humanity said Tuesday that members of the panel are ready to go anywhere to talk to the North's government — but it refuses to engage....
docs.lead_paragraph: The leader of a U.N. commission of inquiry that found North Korea committed crimes against humanity said Tuesday that members of the panel are ready to go anywhere to talk to the North's government — but it refuses to engage.

headline.main: UN Commission Leader Would Be 'Happy' to Talk to NKorea
headline.print_headline: UN Commission Leader Would Be 'Happy' to Talk to NKorea

docs.snippet: The last time Andy Ricker lived in Los Angeles, he worked at a pizza shop, lived in a neighborhood known as "Ghost Town," and much of the city was cloaked in a noxious veil of drugs and crime. When he left to travel the world in 1986, he swore he'...
docs.lead_paragraph: The last time Andy Ricker lived in Los Angeles, he worked at a pizza shop, lived in a neighborhood known as "Ghost Town," and much of the city was cloaked in a noxious veil of drugs and crime. When he left to travel the world in 1986, he swore he'd never come back.

headline.main: Thai Food Ambassador Andy Ricker Was Ready to Return to LA
headline.print_headline: Thai Food Ambassador Andy Ricker Was Ready to Return to LA

docs.snippet: Lawyers in suits related to the storm say they have found at least 500 cases in which engineering reports were altered to minimize payments....
docs.lead_paragraph: Lawyers in suits related to the storm say they have found at least 500 cases in which engineering reports were altered to minimize payments.
docs.abstract: Lawyers representing homeowners whose houses were severely damaged during Hurricane Sandy have uncovered more than 500 doctored engineering reports, which have been used by insurance companies to deny claims; discovery has spurred FEMA to undertake investigation into how reports were doctored, as well as criminal inquiry by New York Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman.

headline.main: Hurricane Sandy Victims Say Damage Reports Were Altered
headline.print_headline: Storm Victims Say Damage Reports Were Altered
